item.title: Report X-2023031278
item.description:
Report X-2023031278

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T18:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-26
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was delivered in Memphis TN on 3/13, then it mysteriously showed up back at MEML on 3/24. Someone at MEML did a DPR on it but did not follow correct damaged hazmat protocol, so it was immediately repacked and RTSed. the repacked return package was discovered on 3/26 at MPGR around 6:30pm when it came down the FLEX slide. the package handler working FLEX alerted QA about it, who retrieved the package to inspect. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap, staining the label of one of the unregulated products in the same package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023031248
item.description:
Report X-2023031248

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T18:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-24
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was discovered this morning on the inbound sometime after it was scanned to a van. no information was provided to the HESS specialist about what exactly took place, but it was at some point removed from the van and placed in a lined tote, then brought to the damage area and placed atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: there is a large rip in the cardboard box on both sides of one corner, and all jerricans have minor to moderate denting on bottom. one jerrican in particular got its handle ripped off, barely hanging attached to top of jerrican, and this created small holes where the metal handle was previously adhered to metal jerrican top. Product leaked through these holes and proceeded to cause minor staining on containers and inside of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT CART OVER AS THEY SMELT A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM ONE OF THE PACKAGES ON HIS CART BUT DID NOT SEE ANY SIGNES OF LEAKING CONTENTS. RESPONDER SMELT THE PACKAGES AND FOUND A PACKAGE WITH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS THAT DID SEEM TO HAVE A STRONG ODOR. UPPON OPENING UP THE FLAPS RESPONDER DISCOVERED 4 1GAL JUGS WITH 1 JUG LEAKED A SMALL AMOUNT OF LIQUID.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat discovered this morning on the inbound. it is not known whether the product arrived damaged or sustained damage due to handling upon being unloaded. but once the leak was discovered, in-house cleanup was performed and the drum was placed in a lined tote, moved to drain mats in incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: bottom rim is dented, and much further away there is a puncture in bottom of drum through which the product leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats. once the HESS specialist inspected, they turned the drum upside down so as to prevent further release.

  • City: SHAKOPEE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Univar Solutions USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Plant personnel noticed material leaking from a super sack. Profile # 97-9088 shipped on #024447678JJK. When the leak was detected the super sack and pallet were placed on a containment pallet. Cleanup contractor was called to have the material in the SSK be repackaged into drums. Supersack did not have inner liner and material contained limited amount of liquids from wet filter materials. An estimated 1/2 gallon leaked out of the SSK and most of the material was soaked up by a cardboard pad on the pallet. Customer was contacted and confirmed that supersack will have inner liners.

item.title: Report X-2023030547
item.description:
Report X-2023030547

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T18:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-08
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS INFORMED OF A LEAKHING HAZMAT IN LOAD WALL 4. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER FOUND A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH BOTH 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS ON ONE OF THE IRREG ROLLERS WITH A WET CORNER AND A FEW DRIPPS OF LIQUID ON THE FLOOR. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND BROUGHT IS BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING. WHILE PROCESSING THE PACKAGE RESPONDER DISCOVERED 4 1GAL CONTAINERS IN THE PACKAGE, RESPONDER DISCOVERED 1 HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH ALLOWED SOME OF ITS CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. X-2023030553: WHEN REMOVING THE PACKAGE FROM THE IRREG ROLLERS, THE AUDITOR NOTICED THAT THE CORNER WAS STAINED. THE AUDITOR CONTACTED THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER. ONE OF FOUR INNER CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP, NEARLY DISLODGED, THE OUTER BOX WAS STAINED. THE CONTAINERS HAVE VENTED CAPS, PREVENTING THEIR RETURN IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL FOUR CONTAINERS MUST BE DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP. X-2023030554: HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT OVER A HAZMAT WITH A 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS SAYING THAT THERE WAS A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER FOUND THAT THERE WERE 4 1 GAL CONTAINERS IN THE PACKAGE AND 1 LEAKED FROM THE CAP. RESPONDER PROCESSED SPILLED MATERIALS.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XMP experienced a UN1263 "Standard Performance Topcoat CAT Yellow Paint" release from (12) 5-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' & 4' x 15' areas of the trailer floor and an 8' x 10' & 4' x 20' areas of the dock floor from (12) leaking 5-gallon metal pails. The remaining undamaged pails were wiped down and re-palletized for shipment. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All impacted pails and cleanup debris were placed into (5) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package received a code 10 yesterday afternoon. The driver brought it back to the station, but the QA admins doing pickup last night did not find it until after 9:30pm. They brought it back to the damage area and placed it in a lined tote. This afternoon the HESS specialist started working on damages in the damage area. Upon beginning to inspect this package, they discovered that the product was the same product that they entered in HESS two months ago as an undeclared hazmat. This package just has the bottles as a larger size. Upon confirming the product's regulation status via safety data sheet, HESS specialist performed in-house cleanup and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. In-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: One bottle leaked due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEN experienced a UN1824 Gardobond Additive H 7212 release from a 275-gallon poly tote due to a puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 9-gallons of product released to a 6' x 6' area of the dock floor due to a puncture. The product was transferred into a new poly tote. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents and cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found loaded on the belly of trailer 836908 with packages on top of it. The liquid inside froze and leaked out of one of the inner containers. Further inspection of SPIDR pictures show package was leaking at stn MPGR - 553 on 12/1/22 13:54. DescribePack: contents froze and was forced out through the sealed bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was frozen and then un-thawed causing the release. The package also appears to have been loaded on a trailer after it was already leaking. Haz-mat packages need special handling and careful attention to make sure they are not damaged or appear leaking. If this had been noticed before it was loaded onto the trailer it would not have leaked inside the trailer.

item.title: Report E-2022120356
item.description:
Report E-2022120356

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-16
  • City: MONTICELLO
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 16, 2022, at 0600 EST, an XPO Logistics tractor trailer was involved in a single vehicle rollover accident. As a result, the unit experienced a cargo release of UN1760 Reglone Desiccant from a 120-gallon poly tote. Approximately 30- gallons of product released to the snow and soil shoulder. No drains or waterways were reported to have been impacted. ERTS dispatched Rock Leaf Water Environmental (RLW) to perform emergency response and remediation. On November 16, 2022, at 0905 EST, RLW personnel arrived on site and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to 2 x 75 area of soil and snow. RLW advised the containers were not damaged but released from a gasket/seal system not designed to support the container being inverted. Released material was collected by scraping the impacted snow and soil with a skid steer. All cargo was then transported to the XPO terminal located in Fridley, MN for continued shipment. The soil remaining was confirmed clean by the DOT and RLW with no further remediation needed. All contaminated soil, snow, and absorbents were placed into two 55-gallon poly drums and removed from site pending disposal. Please see attached photos (Appendix 2). On December 8, 2022, RLW returned to the spill site to complete confirmation soil sampling for TCLP Pesticides per MN Pollution Control Agency request. Due to wet conditions as a result of recent snow melt, site restoration will take place at a later date.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package received a van scan this morning. sometime after that, damage was suspected inside the package. it was brought over to the damage area and opened. whoever opened it suspected it may be undeclared hazmat and brought it over to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. upon arriving to work HESS specialist found the package in the damage area and inspected it, confirming that it is undeclared and requires declaration. placed in lined tote. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: both cans have denting on the sides. one can was dented badly enough that the lid popped off, allowing product to leak out. most of the product stayed in the can and began to solidify, but there is minor spillage on interior of outer box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: moved to drain mats. placed in lined tote.

RESPONDER BROUGHT PACKAGE TO PROCESSING AREA, DISCOVERED ONE OF THE CONTAINERS' VENTED CAPS WAS VERY LOOSE. THE CONTENTS LEAKED FROM THE INNER CONTAINER AND STAINED THE PACKAGING. X-2022101175 RESPONDER WAS TOLD ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKER AT DOOR 171. UPPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER WAS POINTED TO A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH CLASS 5.1 AND CLASS 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS THAT HAD A STONG CHEMICAL ODOR. RESPONDER TOOK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP AND ON FURTHER INSPECTION FOUND ONE OF THE CONTAINERS IN THE PACKAGE HAD A CAP THAT WAS LOOSE AND THE CARDBOARD INSIDE WAS WET/STAINED.

  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred, During inspection prior to transport, driver discovered leak inside of the trailer. Trailer was isolated and Environmental Restoration LLC (ERLLC) was dispatched to inspect the Ieaking tote. ERLLC arrived and inspected the site. ERLLC determined that the tote had a small puncture and liquid was sloshing during transport resulting in the release. The trailer was secured pending product transfer the following day. On July 8 ERLLC returned to the site. ERLLC pumped the product from the Ieaking site into a new tote for delivery. ERLLC deployed absorbent material to recover the free liquid from the trailer floor. The waste was left on site for disposal by N&M Transfer.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Circle K reported 200-gallons of Gasoline released from being overfilled impacting a concrete parking area. ERTS dispatched Rock Leaf Water Environmental (RLW) to conduct all onsite clean up operations. Prior to RLW arrival, The City Roads Dept. covered the spill with soil to contain the spill. On July 14, 2022, at 1344 ET, RLW personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 200-gallons of product released to a 40' X 40' concrete lot. There was a culvert that ran off the edge of the parking lot; the drainage culvert leads to soil and a pipe that leads to the sewer. An approximate 10' area of soil between the end of the culvert and the pipe that is pending excavation. RLW collected and containerized (10) 55-gallon Metal Drums of gasoline impacted solids. All waste was transported to RLW facility.

  • Description: At 1514 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XMP) about a cargo release. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the top of the container and did not impact the dock floor. ERTS dispatched Rock Leaf Water (RLW) to conduct cleanup. The damaged drum was placed into an 85 gallon metal drum, no cleanup was needed. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 27, 2022, Landstar notified ERTS of a 5-gallon release of UN1866 Resin Solution on trailer no. 672190. One or two out of five 55-gallon metal drums were leaking, due to the driver breaking suddenly to avoid hitting a animal, which caused the drums to shift. Rock Leaf was dispatched by ERTS to perform the clean up. Rock Leaf arrived onsite and advised that 10-gallons of product released to a 10' by 10' area of the trailer floor. No other other mediums were impacted. The contractor advised that all 5 drums had were damaged and would be overpacked into 85-gallon DM's. The crew generated (5) 85-gallon DM containing the damaged drums, one 55-gallon DM containing impacted absorbents, debris and PPE, and one 55-gallon DM containing impacted absorbents. Rock Leaf departed the site with the waste to be profiled and disposed of properly.

  • City: CLOQUET

  • Carrier/Reporter: CONVENIENCE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was working around construction equipment. He threw 2 - 20' hoses under their trailer. He was able to hook to one hydrant but the second hose was caught under the construction trailer. He walked around to free it up and while on that side of the trailer he connected the second hose to the trailer, forgetting about not having hooked one hose to a drop hydrant. He started the flow of product and realized he hadn't linked the second hose when he saw product flowing on the ground. He immediately stopped flow and started to contain the product. Driver used spill kits and socks in the flow channel and covered the storm drain with a mat. Product was contained to a hard surface and did not enter any waterways.

item.title: Report X-2022051216
item.description:
Report X-2022051216

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-19T21:44:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-06
  • City: New Brighton
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Wisconsin Central Railroad Ltd.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CN DGO was contacted by CN Mechanical supervisor about tank car PROX 42073 (Load / UN 3082 / Class 9 / PG III ) that was rejected from Minnesota Commercial Railroad in New Brighton, MN. The railcar had product on the sides of the car that appeared to be coming from the manway cover. The railcar was isolated. All required notifications were made. CN Response team responded and also observed the railcar with product on the sides. Upon closer inspection, a shipper seal was found intact on the manway cover lid. The manway bolts were checked for tool tightness and 2 were found to be loose. The manway bolts were properly tightened which secured the leak. The exterior of the railcar was cleaned of all product residue. The railcar was released onto destination.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP BY THE RESPONDER FROM DOOR 109 AROUND 3:30AM. IN THE DMP PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN, FOUR, 1 GALLON PLASTIC JUGS OF ZEP ACIDIC TOILET BOWL CLEANER, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT (UN3264, CORROSIVE LIQUID, ACIDIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S. (HYDROCHLORIC ACID, SULFAMIC ACID), 8, CORROSIVE MATERIAL). TWO OF THE FOUR PLASTIC JUGS, IN THE PACKAGE HAD LEAKING CAPS, WHICH ALLOWED ENOUGH OF THE ACID TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTER CARTON PLUS ALL FOUR INNER JUGS. ALL PRODUCT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.
